info.name: Bansal Immigration - CRM API
info.description:
Complete API collection for integrating Bansal Immigration appointment system with CRM.

## Setup Instructions

1. Import this collection into Postman
2. Import the environment file (Bansal_CRM_API.postman_environment.json)
3. Set your API token in the environment variables
4. Start testing!

## Authentication

All endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Set the `api_token` variable in your environment.

## Rate Limiting

- Limit: 60 requests per minute
- Exceeding limit returns 429 status

## Base URL

https://bansalimmigration.com/api/crm

request.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of appointments with optional filters.

### Query Parameters

- `per_page` - Results per page (default: 50, max: 100)
- `page` - Page number
- `start_date` - Filter by appointment start date (Y-m-d)
- `end_date` - Filter by appointment end date (Y-m-d)
- `status` - Filter by status
- `location` - Filter by office location
- `enquiry_type` - Filter by enquiry type
- `created_after` - Incremental sync: get records created after datetime
- `updated_after` - Incremental sync: get records updated after datetime

### Use Cases

**Initial Full Sync:**
```
GET /appointments?per_page=100
```

**Incremental Sync:**
```
GET /appointments?updated_after=2024-11-18T10:30:00Z
```

**Filter by Date Range:**
```
GET /appointments?start_date=2024-11-01&end_date=2024-11-30
```

query.description: Number of minutes to look back (default: 30, min: 1, max: 1440)

request.description:
Get appointments created in the last N minutes. Perfect for polling scenarios.

### Query Parameters

- `minutes` - Number of minutes to look back (default: 30, min: 1, max: 1440)

### Use Cases

**Polling Every 5 Minutes:**
```
GET /appointments/recent?minutes=10
```
(Use 10 minutes with 5-minute polling to ensure no records are missed)

**Hourly Check:**
```
GET /appointments/recent?minutes=65
```

**Daily Catch-up:**
```
GET /appointments/recent?minutes=1440
```

### Recommended Setup

- Poll every 5-10 minutes
- Use lookback of 15 minutes (buffer for timezone/clock drift)
- Handle duplicates by checking `external_id`

request.description:
Download appointments as CSV file for bulk import into CRM or data analysis.

### Query Parameters

Supports same filters as GET /appointments:
- `start_date` - Filter by appointment start date
- `end_date` - Filter by appointment end date
- `status` - Filter by status
- `location` - Filter by location
- `enquiry_type` - Filter by enquiry type

### CSV Columns

- ID
- Name
- Email
- Phone
- Location
- Meeting Type
- Language
- Enquiry Type
- Service Type
- Appointment Date
- Appointment Time
- Duration
- Status
- Is Paid
- Amount
- Final Amount
- Promo Code
- Admin Notes
- Created At
- Updated At

### Limits

- Maximum 10,000 records per export
- For larger datasets, use multiple requests with date ranges

### Download with cURL

```bash
curl -X GET "{{base_url}}/appointments/export?start_date=2024-01-01" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -o appointments.csv
```

request.description:
Get aggregated statistics about appointments for a date range.

### Query Parameters

- `start_date` - Start date (Y-m-d format). Default: start of current month
- `end_date` - End date (Y-m-d format). Default: end of current month

### Statistics Included

- Total appointments
- Count by status (pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled)
- Paid appointments count
- Total revenue
- Breakdown by enquiry type
- Breakdown by location

### Use Cases

**Current Month Stats:**
```
GET /appointments/stats
```

**Custom Date Range:**
```
GET /appointments/stats?start_date=2024-01-01&end_date=2024-12-31
```

**Last 7 Days:**
```
GET /appointments/stats?start_date=2024-11-11&end_date=2024-11-18
```

item.name: Health Check

request.description:
Quick test to verify API connectivity and token validity.

If this returns 200 OK, your setup is correct.

Possible responses:
- 200 OK - API is accessible, token is valid
- 401 Unauthorized - Token is invalid or missing
- 429 Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded
- 500 Server Error - Server issue
